widget.name: React ArcGIS
widget.description: A React based ArcGIS widget to display layers on a ArcGIS hosted map including interaction with Mendix objects.

property.caption: Height
property.description: The map's height in pixels. Setting it to 10.000 will set it to 100 of the view height and resize it dynamically when zooming.

property.caption: Width
property.description: The map's width in pixels. Setting it to 10.000 will set it to 100 % of the width of the screen and will resize it dynamically when zooming.

property.caption: Base Default Map
property.description: Default map is "topo". Pick one of the values as published by Esri: https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-Map.html#basemap

property.caption: Spatial Reference
property.description: The spatial reference of a map, layer, or inputs to and outputs from a task. Each projected and geographic coordinate system is defined by either a well-known ID (WKID) or a definition string (WKT). Note that versions prior to ArcGIS 10 only wkid was supported.

property.caption: Default Y
property.description: Default Y location for the map to start at.

property.caption: Default X
property.description: Default X for the map to start at.

property.caption: Default Zoom Level
property.description: The zoom level used when displaying a map only.

property.caption: Object Zoom Level
property.description: The zoom level used when focussing on an object.

property.caption: Object Identifier attribute
property.description: The unique object identifier. Can either be the actual Esri ID (ObjectId) or some other supposed to be unique field. If it is not the Esri ID, then in your layer configurations, also add the settings Client ID and Client ID Attribute Type

property.caption: Layer ID attribute
property.description: The unique layer id the object is stored in.

property.caption: Legend Type attribute
property.description: The attribute determining the type of the object. Is used in case of custom styling as label for object in Legend

property.caption: Color attribute
property.description: The attribute determining the Color of the object. Is used to overrule default colors from ArcGIS.

property.caption: Size attribute
property.description: The attribute determining the Size of the object. Is used to overrule default colors from ArcGIS. 4 is small, 50 very large.

property.caption: Symbol attribute
property.description: The attribute determining the Symbol of the object. Is used to overrule default symbol from ArcGIS.

property.caption: Show all ArcGIS Objects
property.description: If enabled all objects in layers will be shown and objects fed from this data source highlighted. If disabled only the objects fed from this data source are shown.

property.caption: Highlight Mendix Objects
property.description: If enabled all available Mendix objects in datasource will be hightlighted with bright blue color.

property.caption: Enable
property.description: This decides whether a legend is available for the plotted layers.

property.caption: Start Expanded
property.description: This decides whether the legend is expanded on first load of map.

property.caption: Title
property.description: The title to appear in the legend.

property.caption: Position
property.description: Determine where the widget should be position on the map.

property.caption: Placeholder Index
property.description: If more widgets, like Search, have same location selected, use this attribute to make it appear first (1) or second (2).

property.caption: Enable Search
property.description: Whether a Search Bar will be added to the map to search for and zoom to a typed in address.

property.caption: Start Expanded
property.description: This decides whether the search box is expanded on first load of map.

property.caption: Position
property.description: Determine where the widget should be position on the map.

property.caption: Placeholder Index
property.description: If more widgets, like Legend, have same location selected, use this attribute to make it appear first (1) or second (2).

property.caption: Enable Toggle Layer
property.description: Whether a Toggle Layer will be added to the map to toggle visibility of graphics within the layer.

property.caption: Start Expanded
property.description: This decides whether the toggle layer list is expanded on first load of map.

property.caption: Position
property.description: Determine where the widget should be position on the map.

property.caption: Placeholder Index
property.description: If more widgets, like Legend, have same location selected, use this attribute to make it appear first (1) or second (2).

property.caption: Layer Definitions
property.description: Add one or multiple layers to plot on the basemap.

property.caption: Layer Server Type
property.description: Determines which layer server type to use. Preferred is FeatureServer. Currently actually a MapServer can be chosen but it will be loaded as FeatureServer. A PortalItem is a customized map by a client based on a actual FeatureServer. It has a unique id which can be entered below.

property.caption: Static Layer URL
property.description: Configure a static URL of the layer here.

property.caption: Dynamic Layer URL
property.description: Layer URL dynamic source. If configured, overrules above possibly configured 'Static Layer URL' value.

property.caption: URL attribute
property.description: The URL attribute for the layer.

property.caption: Layer ID
property.description: The name/identifier of the layer to appear in the toggle layers pane. Should correspond with Layer ID attribute of Mendix object if used.

property.caption: Object ID
property.description: The esri Field storing the unique identifier of the object. Look it up in the layer definition of ArcGIS, field which has type: esriFieldTypeOID. Value is case sensitive

property.caption: Client ID
property.description: (Optional) The client/customer ID attribute, which can be used next to the Object ID. Needs to be stored on the ArcGIS side as well.

property.caption: Client ID Attr Type
property.description: The client/customer ID attribute type

property.caption: Feature Layer ID
property.description: (FeatureLayer only) The ID of the FeatureLayer.

property.caption: Mendix Layer
property.description: One Feature Layer can be connected to Mendix Objects. This layer will also be used for sketching if enabled. See own Sketch tab as well.

property.caption: Portal Item ID
property.description: (PortalItem only) The unique ID of a portal item. Typically looks like: aa1d3f80270146208328cf66d022e09c

property.caption: Visible Layer Indexes
property.description: (MapLayer only) The indexes, concatenated and separated with a comma, of the Layers to show on the basemap. So, if you want to show layers 2 and 3, add 2, 3 here.

property.caption: Visibility On Load
property.description: If set to 'Yes' the layer starts with the layer ticked, hence visible.

property.caption: Clustering
property.description: (Only applicable if clustering enabled) Determines for this layer whether to enable clustering. Advise only to use for point layers.

property.caption: Custom Styling
property.description: Whether to overrule styling for the objects in this layer. Will use color + type of GISObject + mapping of default color + type as defined for Layer ID in 'Custom Coloring'

property.caption: Show Attribution
property.description: Whether to show the attribution (who contributed to the map ESRI, Nasa, Kadaster, etc) of the Layer or not.

property.caption: Layer Opacity
property.description: (FeatureLayer only) Adjust the opacity of the objects plotted on the map. 1.0 is fully opaque, 0.0 is fully transparent. For polyons typically use 0.5.

property.caption: Dynamic Layer Data source
property.description: Load the main client layer as a static layer, perhaps adding the Client ID for quering and use this data source to add specific other supporting layers not being the main layer.

property.caption: Layer ID Attr
property.description: The name/identifier of the layer to appear in the toggle layers pane. Should correspond with Layer ID attribute of Mendix object if used. For a PortalItem enter the portal item id here. See static layer config for an example.

property.caption: Layer Server Type Attr
property.description: Determines which layer server type to use. Preferred is FeatureServer

property.caption: Visibility On Load
property.description: Determines the visibility of the layer once the map loads the first time.

property.caption: Clustering Enabled
property.description: (Only applicable if clustering enabled) Determines for this layer whether to enable clustering. Advise only to use for point layers.

property.caption: Custom Styling Enabled
property.description: Whether to overrule styling for the objects in this layer. Will use mapping as defined for Layer ID in 'Custom Coloring'

property.caption: URL Attr
property.description: The static layer URL

property.caption: Object ID Attr
property.description: The esri Field storing the unique identifier of the object. Look it up in the layer definition of ArcGIS, field which has type: esriFieldTypeOID. Value is case sensitive

property.caption: Mendix Objects Attr
property.description: The ONE Feature Layer which can be connected to Mendix objects. If sketching is enabled, this layer will be used.

property.caption: Default Custom Styling
property.description: (MendixLayer only) Add default appearance to the GISObjects.

property.caption: Layer ID
property.description: (MendixLayer only) the Layer ID to apply the mapping to as used in static/dynamic layer config.

property.caption: Default Color
property.description: The default color for all objects in the Mendix Layer that are not stored in Mendix. If left empty will leave color as is. Can be hexadecimal #FF0000 or RGB: 255,0,0

property.caption: Default Size
property.description: The default size for all objects in the Mendix Layer that are not stored in Mendix. 4 is small, 50 is very large

property.caption: Default Symbol
property.description: Determine the symbol for the graphic.

property.caption: Legend Entries
property.description: (MendixLayer only) Add legend entries for custom styled GISObjects.

property.caption: Layer ID
property.description: (MendixLayer only) the Layer ID to apply the mapping to as used in static/dynamic layer config.

property.caption: Name
property.description: The name of the legend entry to appear next to the symbol with set size and color.

property.caption: Color
property.description: The color for the legend entry. Can be hexadecimal #FF0000 or RGB: 255,0,0

property.caption: Size
property.description: The size for the legend entry. 4 is small, 50 is very large

property.caption: Symbol
property.description: Determine the symbol for the graphic of the legend entry

property.caption: Attributes Array
property.description: Add one or multiple attributes to the pop-up of a configured layer.

property.caption: Attribute Name
property.description: The name of the attribute in the layer to appear in the pop-up. Case sensitive and on ArcGIS side mostly defined as all uppercase.

property.caption: Mendix Owned
property.description: If marked as a Mendix Owned label, based on this attribute name, the value will be retrieved from Mendix instead of ArcGIS.

property.caption: Attribute Label
property.description: The label to appear next to the attribute value retrieve for 'Attribute Name'.

property.caption: Layer ID
property.description: The ID of the layer the attribute is stored in. This value needs to agree with a value configured in 'Layers' > 'Layer definitions' > 'Layer ID'.

property.caption: Is Title
property.description: Determines whether to make this attribute available in the title of the pop-up.

property.caption: Decimals
property.description: (Decimal field only) Determine the amount of decimals to appear.

property.caption: Separator
property.description: (Decimal field only) Determine the separator used for thousands

property.caption: XPath String
property.description: (Workaround) Here, add the XPath (without // prefix, but with Domain Model name) to the Esri (mostly ObjectId) stored on the Mendix object. Pluggable widgets API is lacking possibility to select a microflow only.

property.caption: Label
property.description: The label of the button to appear in the infowindow. If extra button is not needed, add DISABLE here

property.caption: Class
property.description: The classes on the button to appear in the infowindow. By default mendix default classes are added. Those can be stripped and/or your own class added. One can also use the Esri Font library classes, available at: https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/esri-icon-font/

property.caption: Icon
property.description: Button Icon

property.caption: Label
property.description: The label of the button to appear in the infowindow. If extra button is not needed, add DISABLE here

property.caption: Class
property.description: The classes on the button to appear in the infowindow. By default mendix default classes are added. Those can be stripped and/or your own class added. One can also use the Esri Font library classes, available at: https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/esri-icon-font/

property.caption: Icon
property.description: Button Icon

property.caption: Label
property.description: The label of the button to appear in the infowindow. If extra button is not needed, add DISABLE here

property.caption: Class
property.description: The classes on the button to appear in the infowindow. By default mendix default classes are added. Those can be stripped and/or your own class added. One can also use the Esri Font library classes, available at: https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/esri-icon-font/

property.caption: Icon
property.description: Button Icon

property.caption: Enabled
property.description: Decide whether clustering and all settings below should be used when displaying the map.

property.caption: Text Color
property.description: The hexadecimal color or the counter amount to appear in the cluster.

property.caption: Text Size
property.description: The text size for the counter appearing in the clustered point,

property.caption: Popup Title
property.description: The title of the popup to appear on click of a cluster.

property.caption: Popup Title
property.description: The content for the popup. {cluster_count} is an aggregated variable available within clusters to be used.

property.caption: Radius
property.description: Radius for adjacent points to be clustered.

property.caption: Min Size
property.description: Minimum Size for clustering

property.caption: Max Size
property.description: Maximum Size for clustering

property.caption: API Key
property.description: (Doesn't work properly yet!) The API Key to use to access secured content of ArcGIS.

property.caption: Token DataSource
property.description: One token should be stored in the database and according to its expiry date renewed! Typically connect a datasource microflow here that get's the token and if expired gets a new token and stores it.

property.caption: User Id
property.description: The user id for which the token is created

property.caption: Token
property.description: The token attribute

property.caption: Expiry Datetime
property.description: The expiry attribute

property.caption: Enable
property.description: This decides whether the Sketch widget will be enabled. It can only be enabled for one layer currently! Also enable sketch on that layer in the Layer Config.

property.caption: Reversal Enabled
property.description: This decides whether the reverse option will be available. It can only be enabled for one layer currently! Also enable sketch on that layer in the Layer Config.

property.defaultValue: Fill with Layer ID of configured layer!
property.caption: Layer ID
property.description: Skething can only be enabled on one layer. At the layer id here, which should correspond with one of the Layer ID's of the corresponding layers.

property.caption: Position
property.description: Determine where the widget should be position on the map.

property.caption: Placeholder Index
property.description: If more widgets, like Search, have same location selected, use this attribute to make it appear first (1) or second (2).

property.caption: Association Name
property.description: The name of the association to the object that groups the GISObjects from 'Data source' > 'Graphic' together. Will be emptied for the objects not selected anymore in the rectangle sketch action.

property.caption: Parent Object
property.description: If enabling sketching, typically the ArcGIS objects are related to a parent entity via an association. Retrieve this parent entity here.
